00029 void MIDI_Class::begin(const byte inChannel) {
00030         
00031 #if COMPFLAG_MIDI_OUT
00032         
00033 #if USE_RUNNING_STATUS
00034         mRunningStatus_TX = InvalidType;
00035 #endif // USE_RUNNING_STATUS
00036         
00037 #endif // COMPFLAG_MIDI_OUT
00038         
00039         
00040 #if COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN
00041         
00042         mInputChannel = inChannel;
00043         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00044         
00045 #endif // COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN
00046         
00047         
00048 #if (COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN && COMPFLAG_MIDI_OUT) // Thru
00049         
00050         mThruFilterMode = Full;
00051         
00052 #endif // Thru
00053         
00054 }

00060 const byte MIDI_Class::genstatus(const kMIDIType inType,const byte inChannel) {
00061         return ((byte)inType | (inChannel & 0x0F));
00062 }
00063 
00070 void MIDI_Class::send(kMIDIType type, byte data1, byte data2, byte channel) {
00071         
00072         // Protection: remove MSBs on data
00073         data1 &= 0x7F;
00074         data2 &= 0x7F;
00075         
00076         // Then test if channel is valid
00077         if (channel >= MIDI_CHANNEL_OFF) {
00078                 
00079 #if USE_RUNNING_STATUS  
00080                 mRunningStatus_TX = InvalidType;
00081 #endif 
00082                 
00083                 return; // Don't send anything
00084         }
00085         
00086         if ((byte)type < 0xF0) {
00087                 
00088                 byte statusbyte = genstatus(type,channel);
00089                 
00090 #if USE_RUNNING_STATUS
00091                 // Check Running Status
00092                 if (mRunningStatus_TX != statusbyte) {
00093                         // New message, memorise and send header
00094                         mRunningStatus_TX = statusbyte;
00095                         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(mRunningStatus_TX);
00096                 }
00097 #else
00098                 // Don't care about running status, send the Control byte.
00099                 USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(statusbyte);
00100 #endif
00101                 
00102                 // Then send data
00103                 USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(data1);
00104                 if (type != ProgramChange && type != AfterTouchChannel) {
00105                         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(data2);
00106                 }
00107         }
00108         else {
00109                 // This is a system message and therefore, should not be sent using this command.
00110         }
00111         
00112 }

00115 void MIDI_Class::sendNoteOn(byte NoteNumber,byte Velocity,byte Channel) { send(NoteOn,NoteNumber,Velocity,Channel); }
00117 void MIDI_Class::sendNoteOff(byte NoteNumber,byte Velocity,byte Channel) { send(NoteOff,NoteNumber,Velocity,Channel); }
00119 void MIDI_Class::sendProgramChange(byte ProgramNumber,byte Channel) { send(ProgramChange,ProgramNumber,0,Channel); }
00121 void MIDI_Class::sendControlChange(byte ControlNumber, byte ControlValue,byte Channel) { send(ControlChange,ControlNumber,ControlValue,Channel); }
00123 void MIDI_Class::sendPolyPressure(byte NoteNumber,byte Pressure,byte Channel) { send(AfterTouchPoly,NoteNumber,Pressure,Channel); }
00125 void MIDI_Class::sendAfterTouch(byte Pressure,byte Channel) { send(AfterTouchChannel,Pressure,0,Channel); }
00129 void MIDI_Class::sendPitchBend(unsigned int PitchValue,byte Channel) {
00130 
00131         send(PitchBend,(PitchValue & 0x7F),(PitchValue >> 7) & 0x7F,Channel);
00132         
00133 }
00137 void MIDI_Class::sendPitchBend(double PitchValue,byte Channel) {
00138 
00139         unsigned int pitchval = (PitchValue+1.f)*8192;
00140         if (pitchval > 16383) pitchval = 16383;         // overflow protection
00141         sendPitchBend(pitchval,Channel);
00142         
00143 }

00150 void MIDI_Class::sendSysEx(byte length, byte * array, bool ArrayContainsBoundaries) {
00151         if (!ArrayContainsBoundaries) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(0xF0);
00152         for (byte i=0;i<length;i++) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(array[i]);
00153         if (!ArrayContainsBoundaries) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(0xF7);
00154 }

00156 void MIDI_Class::sendTuneRequest() { sendRealTime(TuneRequest); }

00158 void MIDI_Class::sendTimeCodeQuarterFrame(byte TypeNibble, byte ValuesNibble) {
00159         
00160         byte data = ( ((TypeNibble & 0x07) << 4) | (ValuesNibble & 0x0F) );
00161         sendTimeCodeQuarterFrame(data);
00162         
00163 }

00165 void MIDI_Class::sendTimeCodeQuarterFrame(byte data) {
00166         
00167         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(TimeCodeQuarterFrame);
00168         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(data);
00169         
00170 }

00172 void MIDI_Class::sendSongPosition(unsigned int Beats) {
00173         
00174         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(SongPosition);
00175         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(Beats & 0x7F);
00176         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write((Beats >> 7) & 0x7F);
00177         
00178 }
00179 
00180 void MIDI_Class::sendSongSelect(byte SongNumber) {
00181         
00182         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(SongSelect);
00183         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(SongNumber & 0x7F);
00184         
00185 }

00188 void MIDI_Class::sendRealTime(kMIDIType Type) {
00189         switch (Type) {
00190                 case TuneRequest: // Not really real-time, but one byte anyway.
00191                 case Clock:
00192                 case Start:
00193                 case Stop:      
00194                 case Continue:
00195                 case ActiveSensing:
00196                 case SystemReset:
00197                         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write((byte)Type);
00198                         break;
00199                 default:
00200                         // Invalid Real Time marker
00201                         break;
00202         }
00203 }

00221 bool MIDI_Class::read(const byte inChannel) {
00222         
00223         /*
00224          Algorithme:
00225          - Lancer le parseur pour tenter de récupérer un message.
00226          - Si on a quelque chose, le passer au filter pour le thru
00227          
00228          Algo du parseur:
00229          - Récursif (lancé plusieurs fois jusqu'à obtention d'un message ou fin du buffer série)
00230          - Peut utiliser des callbacks (pour la v3.5) quand un message est terminé.
00231          - Compatible avec le running status entrant 
00232          */
00233         
00234         
00235         if (inChannel >= MIDI_CHANNEL_OFF) return false; // MIDI Input disabled.
00236         
00237         
00238         
00239         
00240         if (parse(inChannel)) {
00241                 /* Filtering Algorithm:
00242                  - Get the extracted message's channel and compare it to the input channel
00243                  - 
00244                  */
00245                 
00246         }
00247         
00248         return false;
00249 }

00251 
00252 bool MIDI_Class::parse(byte inChannel) { 
00253         
00254         // If the buffer is full -> Don't Panic! Call the Vogons to destroy it.
00255         if (USE_SERIAL_PORT.available() == UART_BUFFER_SIZE) { 
00256                 USE_SERIAL_PORT.flush();
00257         }       
00258         
00259         if (USE_SERIAL_PORT.available() <= 0) {
00260                 // No data available.
00261                 return false;
00262         }
00263         else {
00264                 
00265                 /* Parsing algorithm:
00266                  Get a byte from the serial buffer.
00267                  • If there is no pending message to be recomposed, start a new one.
00268                         - Find type and channel (if pertinent)
00269                         - Look for other bytes in buffer, call parser recursively, until the message is assembled or the buffer is empty.
00270                  • Else, add the extracted byte to the pending message, and check validity. When the message is done, store it.
00271                  */
00272                 
00273                 
00274                 byte extracted = USE_SERIAL_PORT.read();
00275                 
00276                 if (mPendingMessageIndex == 0) { // Start a new pending message
00277                         mPendingMessage[0] = extracted;
00278                         
00279                         // Check for running status first
00280                         switch (getTypeFromStatusByte(mRunningStatus_RX)) {
00281                                         // Only these types allow Running Status:
00282                                 case NoteOff:
00283                                 case NoteOn:
00284                                 case AfterTouchPoly:
00285                                 case ControlChange:
00286                                 case ProgramChange:
00287                                 case AfterTouchChannel:
00288                                 case PitchBend: 
00289                                         
00290                                         // If the status byte is not received, prepend it to the pending message
00291                                         if (extracted < 0x80) {
00292                                                 mPendingMessage[0] = mRunningStatus_RX;
00293                                                 mPendingMessage[1] = extracted;
00294                                                 mPendingMessageIndex++;
00295                                         }
00296                                         
00297                                         // TODO: gérer l'entrelacement des System Real Time avec les running status (et les autres messages..).
00298                                         
00299                                         // Else: well, we received another status byte, so the running status does not apply here.
00300                                         // It will be updated upon completion of this message.
00301                                         
00302                                         break;
00303                                         
00304                                 default:
00305                                         // No running status
00306                                         break;
00307                         }
00308                         
00309                         
00310                         switch (getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0])) {
00311                                         
00312                                         // 1 byte messages
00313                                 case Start:
00314                                 case Continue:
00315                                 case Stop:
00316                                 case Clock:
00317                                 case ActiveSensing:
00318                                 case SystemReset:
00319                                 case TuneRequest:
00320                                         // Handle the message type directly here.
00321                                         mMessage.type = getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0]);
00322                                         mMessage.data1 = 0;
00323                                         mMessage.data2 = 0;
00324                                         mMessage.valid = true;
00325                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00326                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00327                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00328                                         return true;
00329                                         break;
00330                                         
00331                                         // 2 bytes messages
00332                                 case ProgramChange:
00333                                 case AfterTouchChannel:
00334                                 case TimeCodeQuarterFrame:
00335                                 case SongSelect:
00336                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 2;
00337                                         break;
00338                                         
00339                                         // 3 bytes messages
00340                                 case NoteOn:
00341                                 case NoteOff:
00342                                 case ControlChange:
00343                                 case PitchBend:
00344                                 case AfterTouchPoly:
00345                                 case SongPosition:
00346                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 3;
00347                                         break;
00348                                         
00349                                 case SystemExclusive:
00350                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE; // As the message can be any lenght between 3 and MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE bytes
00351                                         break;
00352                                         
00353                                 case InvalidType:
00354                                 default:
00355                                         // This is obviously wrong. Let's get the hell out'a here.
00356                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00357                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00358                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00359                                         return false;
00360                                         break;
00361                         }
00362                         
00363                         // Then update the index of the pending message.
00364                         mPendingMessageIndex++;
00365                         
00366                         // And call the parser, again.
00367                         parse(inChannel);
00368                         
00369                 }
00370                 else { 
00371                         
00372                         
00373                         // First, test if this is a status byte
00374                         if (extracted >= 0x80) {
00375                                 
00376                                 // Reception of status bytes are allowed only for interleaved Real Time message or EOX
00377                                 switch (extracted) {
00378                                         case Clock:
00379                                         case Start:
00380                                         case Continue:
00381                                         case Stop:
00382                                         case ActiveSensing:
00383                                         case SystemReset:
00384 
00385                                                 /*
00386                                                  This is tricky. Here we will have to extract the one-byte message,
00387                                                  pass it to the structure for being read outside the MIDI class,
00388                                                  and recompose the message it was interleaved into.
00389                                                  
00390                                                  Oh, and without killing the running status.. 
00391                                                  
00392                                                  This is done by leaving the pending message as is, it will be completed on next calls.
00393                                                  */
00394                                                 
00395                                                 mMessage.type = (kMIDIType)extracted;
00396                                                 mMessage.data1 = 0;
00397                                                 mMessage.data2 = 0;
00398                                                 mMessage.valid = true;
00399                                                 return true;
00400                                                 
00401                                                 break;
00402                                         
00403                                                 // End of Exclusive
00404                                         case 0xF7:
00405                                                 if (getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0]) == SystemExclusive) {
00406                                                         
00407                                                         // Store System Exclusive array in midimsg structure
00408                                                         for (byte i=0;i<MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE;i++) {
00409                                                                 mMessage.sysex_array[i] = mPendingMessage[i];
00410                                                         }
00411                                                         
00412                                                         // Get length
00413                                                         mMessage.data1 = mPendingMessageIndex+1;
00414                                                         mMessage.data2 = 0;
00415                                                         mMessage.valid = true;
00416                                                         
00417                                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00418                                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00419                                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00420                                                         
00421                                                         return true;
00422                                                 }
00423                                                 else {
00424                                                         // Well well well.. error.
00425                                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00426                                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00427                                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00428                                                         return false;
00429                                                 }
00430 
00431                                                 break;
00432                                         default:
00433                                                 break;
00434                                 }
00435                                 
00436                                 
00437                                 
00438                         }
00439                         
00440                         
00441                         // Add extracted data byte to pending message
00442                         mPendingMessage[mPendingMessageIndex] = extracted;
00443                         
00444                         
00445                         // Now we are going to check if we have reached the end of the message
00446                         if (mPendingMessageIndex >= (mPendingMessageExpectedLenght-1)) {
00447                                 
00448                                 // "FML" case: fall down here with an overflown SysEx..
00449                                 // This means we received the last possible data byte that can fit the buffer.
00450                                 // If this happens, try increasing MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE.
00451                                 if (getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0]) == SystemExclusive) {
00452                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00453                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00454                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00455                                         return false;
00456                                 }
00457                                 
00458                                 
00459                                 // Reset local variables
00460                                 mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00461                                 mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00462                                 
00463                                 mMessage.type = getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0]);
00464                                 mMessage.channel = (mPendingMessage[0] & 0x0F);                         // Don't care if it makes any sense.
00465                                 
00466                                 if (mPendingMessageExpectedLenght >= 2) mMessage.data1 = mPendingMessage[1]; // Checking this is futile, as 1 byte message were processed in the switch.
00467                                 if (mPendingMessageExpectedLenght >= 3) mMessage.data1 = mPendingMessage[2];
00468                                 
00469                                 mMessage.valid = true;
00470                                 
00471                                 // Activate running status (if enabled for the received type)
00472                                 switch (mMessage.type) {
00473                                         case NoteOff:
00474                                         case NoteOn:
00475                                         case AfterTouchPoly:
00476                                         case ControlChange:
00477                                         case ProgramChange:
00478                                         case AfterTouchChannel:
00479                                         case PitchBend: 
00480                                                 // Running status enabled: store it from received message
00481                                                 mRunningStatus_RX = mPendingMessage[0];
00482                                                 break;
00483                                                 
00484                                         default:
00485                                                 // No running status
00486                                                 mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00487                                                 break;
00488                                 }
00489                                 
00490                                 return true;
00491                         }
00492                         else {
00493                                 // Then update the index of the pending message.
00494                                 mPendingMessageIndex++;
00495                                 
00496                                 // And call the parser, again.
00497                                 parse(inChannel);
00498                         }
00499                         
00500                 }
00501                 
00502                 
00503         }
00504         
00505         // What are our chances to fall here?
00506         return false;
00507 }

00543 void MIDI_Class::setThruFilterMode(kThruFilterMode inThruFilterMode) { 
00544         mThruFilterMode = inThruFilterMode;
00545         if (mThruFilterMode != Off) mThruActivated = true;
00546         else mThruActivated = false;
00547 }
00553 void MIDI_Class::setThruFilterMode(byte inThruFilterMode) { 
00554         mThruFilterMode = (kThruFilterMode)inThruFilterMode;
00555         if (mThruFilterMode != Off) mThruActivated = true;
00556         else mThruActivated = false;
00557 }

00561 void MIDI_Class::turnThruOn(kThruFilterMode inThruFilterMode) { 
00562         mThruActivated = true;
00563         mThruFilterMode = inThruFilterMode;
00564 }
00566 void MIDI_Class::turnThruOff() {
00567         mThruActivated = false; 
00568         mThruFilterMode = Off;

00571 void MIDI_Class::filter(byte inChannel) {
00572         switch (mThruFilterMode) {
00573                 case Off: // Do nothing (Thru disabled)
00574                         break;
00575                 case Full:
00576                         // TODO: voir comment looper les messages complexes.
00577                         send(mMessage.type,mMessage.data1,mMessage.data2,mMessage.channel);
00578                         break;
00579                 case DifferentChannel:
00580                         
00581                         break;
00582                 case SameChannel:
00583                         
00584                         break;
00585                 default:
00586                         break;
00587         }
00588 }
